Reference Text: <S ssid="1" sid="33">Presently,we introduce topic-sensitive LexRank in creating asentence retrieval system.</S><S ssid="1" sid="53">Below,we describe a topic-sensitive version of LexRank,which is more appropriate for the question-focusedsentence retrieval problem.</S><S ssid="1" sid="84">3.4 Experiments with topic-sensitive LexRank.</S><S ssid="1" sid="173">We presented topic-sensitive LexRank and appliedit to the problem of sentence retrieval.</S><S ssid="1" sid="36">Our goal is to build a question-focused sentence retrieval mechanism using a topic-sensitive version ofthe LexRank method.</S>

<S ssid="1" sid="0">Using Random Walks for Question-focused Sentence Retrieval</S><S ssid="1" sid="16">Currently, we address the question-focused sentence retrieval task.</S><S ssid="1" sid="1">We consider the problem of question-focused sentence retrieval from complexnews articles describing multi-event stories published over time.</S><S ssid="1" sid="173">We presented topic-sensitive LexRank and appliedit to the problem of sentence retrieval.</S><S ssid="1" sid="36">Our goal is to build a question-focused sentence retrieval mechanism using a topic-sensitive version ofthe LexRank method.</S>

<S ssid="1" sid="84">3.4 Experiments with topic-sensitive LexRank.</S><S ssid="1" sid="173">We presented topic-sensitive LexRank and appliedit to the problem of sentence retrieval.</S><S ssid="1" sid="187">As discussed in Section 2, our goal wasto develop a topic-sensitive version of LexRank andto use it to improve a baseline system, which hadpreviously been used successfully for query-basedsentence retrieval (Allan et al., 2003).</S><S ssid="1" sid="33">Presently,we introduce topic-sensitive LexRank in creating asentence retrieval system.</S>
<S ssid="1" sid="46">To apply LexRank, a similarity graph is producedfor the sentences in an input document set.</S>

<S ssid="1" sid="36">Our goal is to build a question-focused sentence retrieval mechanism using a topic-sensitive version ofthe LexRank method.</S><S ssid="1" sid="53">Below,we describe a topic-sensitive version of LexRank,which is more appropriate for the question-focusedsentence retrieval problem.</S><S ssid="1" sid="84">3.4 Experiments with topic-sensitive LexRank.</S><S ssid="1" sid="187">As discussed in Section 2, our goal wasto develop a topic-sensitive version of LexRank andto use it to improve a baseline system, which hadpreviously been used successfully for query-basedsentence retrieval (Allan et al., 2003).</S><S ssid="1" sid="173">We presented topic-sensitive LexRank and appliedit to the problem of sentence retrieval.</S>

<S ssid="1" sid="36">Our goal is to build a question-focused sentence retrieval mechanism using a topic-sensitive version ofthe LexRank method.</S><S ssid="1" sid="53">Below,we describe a topic-sensitive version of LexRank,which is more appropriate for the question-focusedsentence retrieval problem.</S><S ssid="1" sid="84">3.4 Experiments with topic-sensitive LexRank.</S><S ssid="1" sid="187">As discussed in Section 2, our goal wasto develop a topic-sensitive version of LexRank andto use it to improve a baseline system, which hadpreviously been used successfully for query-basedsentence retrieval (Allan et al., 2003).</S><S ssid="1" sid="173">We presented topic-sensitive LexRank and appliedit to the problem of sentence retrieval.</S>
